alert.note: Alert for Louisa; Muscatine (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 02 at 6:59PM CST until March 08 at 6:30AM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Cedar River near Conesville affecting Muscatine and Louisa Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON TO WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cedar River near Conesville. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon to Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Water affects residences along County Road F70. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM CST Thursday the stage was 11.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Saturday evening to a crest of 14.0 feet Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued Friday morning.
